Tracy Secombe, like many people, had a challenging year in 2016 following years of pushing herself to achieve ever higher levels of success. When everything started to crumble around her, she was reminded of the importance of reconnecting to her soul and following her true path. As she waded out of the mess she was in, she realized how many other people were stuck, and felt a deep calling to help as many people as possible experience the profound shift she had experienced.

Tracy created the course "From People Pleaser to Soul Pleaser" and delivered it to a wonderful group of people who were looking for meaning in their lives. As a result, these people have experienced shifts from worrying to trust, overwhelm to calmness, procrastination to inspired action toward their goals, confusion to clarity of purpose, better health, relationships and flow of abundance.

If you feel that there must be more to life than you are currently experiencing..you're right!...read more

Tracey first happened upon yoga in 1995 in a gym environment.  She instinctively knew that something in that room pulsing with the strange didgeridoo music was meant to change her life.  From that first class on, she immediately craved the physical movement and thoughtful awareness that yoga offered.  Years later, when her first baby was tragically born still, she knew that it was also a lifeline; Tracey’s experience on her mat could be translated into how she lived her life when she wasn’t wearing yoga pants or trying to get her ankle behind her head.  Dealing with frustrations within the practice (like that darned peacock pose) taught her how to deal with higher stakes emotions, such as grief and despair when she was off the mat. 

Driven by her desire to empower others in their personal journeys off of the mat through the asana, much as she had herself experienced, she decided to serve others by becoming a yoga teacher.  In 2007, she studied with her teacher, Deahna Brown and benefited from her insightful and inspiring wisdom.  She expanded her knowledge in 2015 by attending advanced yoga studies at the Colorado School of Yoga in Boulder, Colorado with Gina Caputo, whose intelligent sequencing and impassioned offering has challenged her to embrace each class she teaches as an opportunity for extraordinary consciousness. 

Tracey has an approachable and down-to-earth style that attracts students who may be apprehensive about practicing yoga.  She is a natural teacher who meets students where they are and supports them in both accepting modifications while continuing to challenge themselves.  Tracey recognizes that people vary greatly in how they learn.  As an experienced teacher both in the classroom and the studio, she is uniquely poised to teach in such a way that all students can benefit from the practice.

In addition to being an Experienced Registered Yoga Teacher (E-RYT 500) with Yoga Alliance and a Certified Prenatal Yoga Teacher, Tracey has a Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Masters of Arts in Education and was awarded Gold in the category of Best Yoga Teacher in the Springs in the Gazette’s Best of the Springs 2015 and 2018 editions.  Additionally, she is the Dean of Students and a teacher on the faculty for the Colorado School of Yoga.  While not on her mat, she can be found singing in the car, eating gelato or dreaming of her next vacation!...read more

The Mindfulness Bell is a music project that began in when I was asked to create meditation music for a series of healing workshops. I have practiced meditation, mostly Zen (Zazen) for over 25 years, which has lead me to learning the very meditative Japanese bamboo flute, the Shakuhachi. The style that I study is hundreds of years old, and was played by monks to help in their focus during meditation. The compositional theory of this style of music provides one of the foundations to my work. My currently available pieces do not feature the shakuhachi, but use a variety of gentle ambiences and organic sounds to create deep calm and aid focus. Future works will feature the Shakuhachi occasionally.

My music is designed to boost concentration and create a smooth flow through the various phases of meditation, however it is also suitable for yoga and similar activites, or simply to help you relax. New work is in production, and selected works from each upcoming release will be made available first and for free to the Insight Timer community.

I have been a user of insight timer since its early days. My time is devoted to ecologically and socially sustainable design projects, personal coaching, making music and my family. I invite you to connect with me through this community and share with me your experiences with my music. Enjoy!

She is passionate about empowering others to understand and know experientially that the body has innate wisdom to heal and regulate itself by using an integrated mind-body approach of pain treatment and management. ...read more

teacher_name: Temple Buddhist Center of Kansas City
about: Temple Buddhist Center offers Western Buddhism, a blend of eastern philosophy and western psychology. This new and exciting form of spirituality is dynamic, inclusive, active, and focuses on core Buddhist insights, mindfulness, meditation and their practical application in our daily life. The center's goal is not to get everyone to agree on a specific lineage, sect or philosophy, but rather to foster a shared experience of mindfulness, oneness, and love....read more

Teal is a holistic therapist, but is perhaps better known as the author TL Clark. She has many years of therapy experience and is a Reiki Master. Her core beliefs are love and kindness.

These guided meditations are dedicated to the spiritual warriors, light workers and indigo adults who have found the courage and willingness to be vulnerable and traverse the dark nights of the soul, for they illuminate our path with jewels of joy, wisdom and heartfelt healing.
